Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup with part of handle root; interior glazed black; exterior: from left, part of tripod leg below part of black handle root; at right, male figures (right forearm and lower body of one, wearing short himation over short chiton with added red dots and holding spear and shield in red; right foot of second wearing long chiton with added white and holding spear), both to right; below, narrow dilute band and black lower wall; repair hole near bottom left break.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 444, no. B732)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0620) (Phase 1)
